page.title: 06The Pheasant Shoot.
page.content: It is usually at the end of October when most of the leaves are off the trees that the first shoot takes place. Lord Hambleden invites seven guns and the gamekeeper employs 30 beaters.The beaters spread out and make a lot of noise to bring the birds along.The guns are ready waiting in a valley having drawn lots for order of shooting.On a good day 250-600 birds are shot.The game cart comes along and the pickers- up with trained dogs,put the birds in heaps.They are tied in a brace and sold to the game dealer in the village who in turn,sells to hotels. The shoot can expect to bag 6000 birds in one season.It costs 2000 pounds per day and visitors come from Holland as do many farmers from Norfolk.
